**The Challenge:**

**In this challenge, you'll need to make a plane that could land on ground and water, and fly in air and space.**

**made from stock parts only, your plane must complete the next steps in the** **following order** **and** **in the same flight****:**

**Step 1: Takeoff from the Land.**

**Step 2: Land somewhere in the Sea.**

**Step 3: Takeoff from the Water.**

**Step 4: Rise up to 50000meters.**

**Step 5: Rise more and make a stable orbit.**

**Step 6: land somewhere in kerbin.**

**For each step you'll have to make an image set, or a video as an approvment.**

**Participation unavailable.**

**No results will be displayed.**

**Changelog:**

(15.03.2015) With the following changes, praticipation end date was changed:

-Scoring system was updated.

-Rule 2 was updated.

-Rule 7 and rule \*6.1 was added.

(24.03.2015)

- Challenge closed - Not enough challengers. 

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-24T17:36:42Z" title="03/24/2015 05:36  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 24, 2015</time> by DeathApocalypse**
  
Not enough challengers.

Here you go:

This is the same floatplane that I used to land on Laythe in the Jool-5 challenge (with one minor modification - the docking port was removed, as there's no need to dock in orbit to refuel for this challenge). Normally I would release the drop tanks once they are empty, but as the rules prohibit this, they stay attached.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/p8vvS)

I don't want to sound mean, but your scoring system seems... Wrong. Giving bonus points for videos is discriminating those with weaker rigs. And in the end, it's more than possible for more people to have the same score - how will you differentiate between those and decide who wins?

I think you right about both things.

The bonus scoring for videos, is going to be removed.

But the option to gain extra points for making a "Mission video", will stay.

And from now, **points will be also archived depending to Craft Mass, and Orbit Altitude(at step 5).**

Introducing the Seagull MK-I, a medium sized watercraft SSTO.

In order to get out of the water more quickly and stop wasting fuel I added a small engine to the nose only that can be used to pitch the nose up once the engines are spooled up. This way it's much easier to lift off from the water without building an actual VTOL plane.

Providing Image album and Video, it may be a day before the video is up though, connection bandwidth is limited and video is LARGE to upload.

Orbit altitude PE: 75.986km

Orbit altitude AP: 84.277km
